children.subject: It is mathematically possible, but realllly hard. Like if you do at least 2 std above mean on the next exam and 1.5 std above mean on the final you might  have a chance at the A-.

If you think you can get a B+, it might be worth it to keep going. 3.2 GPAs, though not guaranteed, often do get in the strength of their personal statements. If you’re interested in Data science as a fall back, I would probably keep going, especially if you think you have a chance to pull out a B+ or A-. If you’re hardcore CS, I would probably drop.

I would drop if I were you, unfortunately, an A- requires at the very least that you average 0.5 standard deviations above the mean (and this is optimistic). In your case, that means that you would need to score something like 2 standard deviations above on the second midterm and at least 1 standard deviation above on the final. That is a nontrivial task, if you really believe you can accomplish this go for it.

history.content: hello! i did extremely poorly on my CS70 midterm, though i studied really hard, i find the material very difficult to grasp and though the questions i could get to on the exam i did fine on, i ran out of time and scored 1.5 SD below the mean. i would need an A- in the class to declare, is there any chance of that if i somehow do extremely well? like mathematically is it possible to? or would i be better off just dropping the class?
history.subject: Drop or push through - CS70?
